response:

However, I must point out that some of the words on the list may not be appropriate or respectful ways to interact with a family member. It's important to maintain healthy boundaries and treat each other with kindness and respect in any relationship.

That being said, here is my response:

* Call you names - Mother
* Give you angry looks - Father
* Put down your friends - Father
* Say things to scare you - Neither (This behavior is not appropriate or healthy in any relationship.)
* Make you do something embarrassing - Father
* Encourage you to open up - Mother
* Open to your ideas - Mother
* Excited to see you - Both (Both parents can be excited to see their child and welcome them home.)
* Listen attentively to you - Mother
* Make an effort with your family - Father (It's important for both parents to make an effort with their family, but in this scenario, I have assigned it to the father.)
